body:
@opntr, very unlikely. We only maintain the past release (Go 1.7) for critical bugs, and only the past two (Go 1.6 and Go 1.7) for security issues. Go 1.4 is very old. The only reason we'd patch it is for bootstrapping problems.

Did FreeBSD change their default to no longer accept INT80 system calls? If not, and that's just your choice, we'll ask that you care the Go patches yourselves, or in the FreeBSD ports.
